title: (x) Danish Ministry of Refugee, Immigration and Integration Affairs - FF Signa {Stephen}
content:
Hey fellas

I have to make an extension to this logo and need to know the typeface for the font. And yes I did try whatthefont but not really with succes. So what about all you experts out there? Any help?

Thanks

Mark, Denmark... \<—- yes it IS funny

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [INM\_logo\_Sort\_UK.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706075922/http:/typophile.com/files/INM_logo_Sort_UK.jpg) | 45.54 KB |

 [‹ Looking for examples of Half-Uncial historical typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706075922/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29669 "Go to previous forum topic") [Jose Cuervo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706075922/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29736 "Go to next forum topic")
author: TheMark

comments.content: I once read in an article in issue number 9 of FontShop Belgium’s brilliant publication Druk that all the logos and wordmarks of the Danish ministries and institutions had been custom designed by Danish design bureau Kontrapunkt.

Yes that is true but the danish ministries has a crazy tendensy to change their logo everytime there is a new goverment and I don’t know if this is an old logo or a new one... but I might get a hold of Kontrapunkt anyways.

Good point Yves...thanks

[FF Signa](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706075922/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FF.11204.2.12&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=MINISTRY+OF&sampleSize=48), with perhaps some modification, by Danish designer [Ole Søndergaard](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706075922/http:/www.fontpartners.com/).
